title: San Francisco/Golden Gate
name: Cavalry Stables and Pet Cemetery
directions: between Lincoln Blvd and McDowell Ave
content: Five brick cavalry stables were built in 1914. Each stable could house 102 horses, enough for a cavalry company. A paddock stood between the stables and the cavalry barracks on the hill behind, and a blacksmith shop was in front. After the cavalry left the stables, they were adapted to other uses — the Pet Cemetery was started and also a veterinary hospital.
